items.title: AZ zoekt naar antwoorden na 'schandalige' vertoning: 'Dit mag ons niet overkomen'
items.summary: AZ heeft voor het eerst in meer dan twintig jaar vier uitduels op rij verloren in de Eredivisie. Van de feestvreugde na de jubelzege op Ajax in het bekertoernooi was niets over na de 'schandalige' nederlaag bij PEC Zwolle. De Alkmaarders verzuimden gebruik te maken van het puntenverlies van Ajax, tot groot ongenoegen van Peer Koopmeiners.

items.title: Telstar geeft voorsprong weg en verzuimt afstand van degradatiezone te nemen
items.summary: Telstar leek zaterdagavond hard op weg om zichzelf een goede dienst te bewijzen in de strijd om lijfsbehoud. De ploeg van Anthony Correia was door doelpunten van Jochem Ritmeester van de Kamp en Nils Rossen dicht bij de eerste competitieoverwinning van 2026. Maar zoals vaker dit seizoen ging het in de slotfase alsnog mis en kwam Excelsior met de schrik vrij.

items.title: PSV moet diep gaan, maar boekt in Sittard vijftiende uitzege op rij
items.summary: PSV heeft zaterdag weer een stap richting de landstitel gezet. Op bezoek van Fortuna Sittard ging het niet makkelijk, maar het team van Peter Bosz won wel weer en staat nu zestien punten voor op achtervolger Feyenoord, dat zondag nog wel in actie komt.

items.title: Jerdy Schouten mist middenvelder Mauro J√∫nior
items.summary: PSV zoekt door de vele afwezigen opnieuw naar de ideale opstelling. De zege bij Fortuna Sittard (1-2) leert dat Jerdy Schouten mogelijk toch weer nodig is op het middenveld.

items.title: VI Live: NAC doet via prachtgoal Soumano wat terug tegen NEC
items.summary: Zaterdagmiddag staan er niet alleen vijf wedstrijden in de Eredivisie op het programma, maar ook in het buitenland staan ons veel mooie potjes te wachten. Te beginnen met de Manchester Derby, gevolgd door onder meer Real Madrid, Liverpool, Arsenal, Bayern M√ºnchen en Internazionale. Volg het (inter)nationale voetbal in deze VI Live.

items.title: Carrick challenges Utd after derby: Let's keep it up
items.summary: Michael Carrick has challenged his Manchester United players to keep it up after stunning Manchester City in his first game in charge.

items.title: Arsenal held by Forest, go 7 points clear of City
items.summary: Arsenal missed the chance to go nine points clear at the top of the Premier League after being held to a 0-0 draw by Nottingham Forest on Saturday.

items.title: Sources: Gu√©hi set for City medical in $27M deal
items.summary: Marc Gu√©hi is set to have a medical on Sunday ahead of his proposed move to Manchester City, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Arsenal stumble in draw against resilient Forest
items.summary: Arsenal missed the chance to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table to nine points, with a goalless draw against a determined Nottingham Forest.

items.title: Ruthless Man Utd beat Man City in dream start for Carrick
items.summary: Michael Carrick gets off to the perfect start in his first match as interim manager for Manchester United with a two-goal derby win against Manchester City, leaving Pep Guardiola's side winless in their past four matches.

items.title: Wasteful Liverpool miss penalty in draw against Burnley
items.summary: Liverpool missed countless chances, including a Dominik Szoboszlai penalty, as a Michael Edwards equaliser grabbed Burnley an important point at Anfield.

items.title: Last-minute Wilson goal leaves fans booing Frank's Spurs
items.summary: A last-minute Callum Wilson goal gives West Ham an important three points and increases the pressure on Tottenham boss Thomas Frank.

items.title: Chelsea beat Brentford for Rosenior's first Premier League win
items.summary: Cole Palmer scored a penalty to secure the a for Chelsea against Brentford and give Liam Rosenior his first Premier League win as manager.

items.title: 'Sinner, Anisimova to claim Australian Open titles as Brits dealt tough draws'
items.summary: Sky Sports Tennis' Gigi Salmon looks ahead to the 2026 Australian Open, revealing her tips to claim the titles and looking at each Brit's draw in her latest column.

items.title: Sels frustrates Arsenal as leaders move seven points clear with draw at Forest
items.summary: This game was summed up neatly in the 82nd minute when two Nottingham Forest players hunted down Gabriel Jesus as the Arsenal substitute tried to see the ball out for a throw-in. Elliot Anderson was not settling for that, crashing into the tackle that actually won his team the restart. Sixty yards down the touchline, Sean Dyche‚Äôs hands went clapping above his head; Mikel Arteta reached his out to either side, palms raised to the skies in incredulity. Yet such is the way of this season. Just as the opportunity knocked, with Manchester City losing to Manchester United earlier in the day, for Arsenal to stretch their lead at the top of the Premier League to nine points, with Nottingham Forest seemingly on the ropes with only one win in six previous games, up comes the underdog with a performance to sum up this manager. Continue reading...

items.title: Man United deliver huge blow to Man City title hopes with shock derby win
items.summary: Manchester City's title bid is as good as over after Manchester United won the midfield battle at Old Trafford.

items.title: VAR review: Should Man United's Dalot have received a red card for foul on Doku?
items.summary: Diogo Dalot saw yellow for catching J√©r√©my Doku on the knee. The VAR agreed, but was it the right call?

items.title: Carrick has dream start as Mbeumo and Dorgu give Manchester United derby delight
items.summary: On 65 minutes Michael Carrick‚Äôs second tenure went electric as Manchester United scored a classic breakaway goal by Bryan Mbeumo that sent the interim head coach berserk in the technical area. After a clearing Harry Maguire header, the ball evaded Rayan Cherki and Bruno Fernandes galloped forward. He had Amad Diallo to the right and Patrick Dorgu and Mbeumo on the left; United‚Äôs streetwise captain delayed the pass, then found the Cameroonian, whose finish beat Gianluigi Donnarumma. Continue reading...

items.title: Thomas Frank believes Tottenham ‚Äòsupertanker‚Äô is turning despite West Ham loss
items.summary: Manager barracked by fans after late 2-1 defeat ‚ÄòWe need to get our head down and do the right thing‚Äô Thomas Frank believes he retains the faith of the Tottenham hierarchy and can turn around what he described as a ‚Äúsupertanker‚Äù of a club ‚Äì despite being barracked by the home crowd after a last-gasp 2-1 loss to West Ham. The fans in the South Stand chanted Frank should be ‚Äúsacked in the morning‚Äù after a defeat that kept them 14th in the Premier League. Spurs have won three of their past 15 matches in the competition. Continue reading...

items.title: Glasner blasts Crystal Palace board for ‚Äòabandoning‚Äô team with Gu√©hi sale
items.summary: Manager makes outburst after 2-1 defeat at Sunderland Austrian angry club sold captain one day before game Oliver Glasner accused Crystal Palace‚Äôs board of ‚Äúabandoning‚Äù his team in the course of a scathing post-match deconstruction after the 2-1 defeat at Sunderland. At times the Austrian, who on Friday announced he would be leaving Selhurst Park at the end of this season, sounded as if he was talking himself out of the remaining few months of his contract.
